hints.content:
The area is the number of unit squares it takes to cover the rectangle.

![Same rectangle with width labeled 3 and height labeled 9.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/84fe296cdb8b4518e889388058684ff657454f8e)

The rectangle has $\tealE{9}$ rows with $\goldE{3}$ unit squares per row.

###Repeated addition

We can find the area by adding the unit squares from each column:

$\underbrace{\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}}_{\goldE{3}\text{ columns}}$

###Multiplication

We can also write repeated addition as multiplication:

$\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}+\tealE{9}=\goldE{3} \times \tealE{9}$

We multiply $\goldE{\text{width}} \times \tealE{\text{height}}$.

We can use these expressions to find the area of the rectangle:

- $9+9+9$
- $3 \times 9$

question.content:
![a square.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a9d343d7f751c448f22a8129dc2139656049e07c) is $1$ unit square.

![a rectangle 3 squares wide and 9 squares high.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bfea6e75590f47d17bfb66bc52352b7dc7bbe2b4)

**Which expressions can we use to find the area of the rectangle?**
